title: Gondi people
summary: The Gondi (G≈çndi) or Gond or Koitur[4] are a Dravidian ethno-linguistic group. They are one of the largest  groups in India.[5][6] They are spread over the states of Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra,[7] Chhattisgarh, Uttar Pradesh, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Bihar and Odisha. They are listed as a Scheduled Tribe for the purpose of India's system of positive discrimination.[8]
